vendor_name: Zanzibar White Sand Luxury Villas & Spa
title: Luxury Zanzibar Beachfront Resort with Rooftop Sunset Bar
description:
The Zanzibar Archipelago is a jewel in the Indian Ocean, and there’s no better way to experience its magic than with a dreamy stay at Zanzibar White Sand Luxury Villas & Spa, part of the exclusive Relais & Châteaux collection and ranked in the top 1% of properties worldwide on Tripadvisor. Perched on the east coast of the island on Paje Beach, this secluded sanctuary is perfect for a post-safari jaunt or some much-needed rest and relaxation. With an onsite spa, two restaurants, a rooftop sunset bar, beach bar and lounge, as well as a kitesurfing and watersports centre, there’s something for everyone.

With rich history waiting to be unearthed, coconut trees swaying in the breeze on flawless beaches and traditional Arabian dhows bobbing in the warm turquoise waters, Zanzibar is what island dreams are made of. To further your understanding of the island’s history, venture to Stone Town - the heart and soul of the island - and marvel at the way African, Arabic, Indian, and Persian influences intertwine to form a fascinating cultural backdrop. Or, you could join a spice tour to the plantations that dot the island to learn about its trading past as ‘Spice Island’.

**Luxury Escapes inclusions:**

- Indulge with **daily breakfast and dinner**
- One **30-minute spa treatment** per adult, per stay
- Welcome **bottle of sparkling wine** on arrival
- Arrive to a special **welcome gift**
- Stay hydrated with a **complimentary bottle of water** per person, per day

**TripAdvisor Travellers’ Choice, Best of the Best 2021 -**Top 25 Small Hotels - Africa

title: Serene Zanzibar Clifftop Oasis with Ocean-View Golf Course
description:
Escape to the island of Zanzibar staying at the Sea Cliff Resort & Spa, a serene hideaway ranked within the top 10% of properties on Tripadvisor, where you can ride horses on the beach, dine overlooking the deep blue Indian Ocean and soak up the history of this fascinating historic trade destination. Fringed by lush tropical terrain on one side and sweeping views of the sparkling waters below, the resort feels perfectly secluded, yet the island’s history-filled capital of Stone Town is just 30-minutes away so you can easily unearth details of the island’s fascinating past.

Wander through tropical gardens and admire the traditional-style architecture with makuti palm tree roofing and opulent Arabic-style towers before stepping inside one of the elegant rooms, complete with luxurious gold accents and handpicked antique furniture. Then, plunge into one of the gleaming infinity pools, pamper yourself at the spa, tee off at the resort's nine-hole, championship-standard golf course, or take a seat at the onsite restaurant and dine under the stars. A spice tour to the plantations across the island is a must-do, along with time spent roaming the magical, cobblestone streets of Stone Town or enjoying a sundowner as you watch Arabian dhows sail along the coastline.
offer_address: Kama Village, Mangapwani, Zanzibar Tanzania 1763, Tanzania
